en.title: Buzz Swarbrick
en.description: I am a seasoned technologist with 20 years of web experience, dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences. I specialise in crafting visually appealing and intuitive web and mobile apps, focusing on user experience to create engaging interfaces that delight users.

description.html:
Senior Frontend Developer

I am a seasoned developer with 20 years of web experience, dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences.

I specialise in crafting visually appealing and intuitive web and mobile apps, focusing on user experience to create engaging interfaces that delight users.

With a strong foundation in technologies such as React and TypeScript, I have demonstrated my ability to adapt to various technologies and frameworks, ensuring dynamic and interactive applications that meet modern standards.
description.markdown:
## Senior Frontend Developer

I am a seasoned developer with 20 years of web experience, dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences.



I specialise in crafting visually appealing and intuitive web and mobile apps, focusing on user experience to create engaging interfaces that delight users.



With a strong foundation in technologies such as React and TypeScript, I have demonstrated my ability to adapt to various technologies and frameworks, ensuring dynamic and interactive applications that meet modern standards.

content.html:
Work Experience

Senior Product Engineer, Alpaca Travel

2016 - present (7 years)

I have been an integral part of Alpaca Travel since its inception in 2016, contributing significantly to its growth and evolution. I played a pivotal role in crafting the initial prototype that laid the foundation for the company's development. From the initial AngularJS prototype, we transitioned to React and related technologies, a transition I actively participated in. My contributions have spanned a range of key products, including multiple iterations of the CMS, as well as widely adopted content viewers featured on notable brands like Dan Murphy's, Destination NSW, Melbourne Food & Wine, and Australian Travel Magazine.

Highlights of my role:

  • Developing Alpaca's fully customised content management system (CMS) tailored for itinerary plotting, boasting advanced features such as customisable branding, AI-driven writing assistance, a robust icon management system, an intuitive embed wizard with preview functionality, and more.
  • Developing the fully responsive and embeddable maps, enhancing the interactive experience for users across all devices.
  • Developing and successfully delivering a React Native iPhone and Android app to the app store, that empowers users to load maps through QR codes and access them offline, promoting seamless usability.
  • Developing / designing downloadable PDFs featuring static maps, custom icons, custom fonts, and branding, delivering a polished and consistent visual identity for brands and their users.
  • Developing the Alpaca Tech landing page and documentation, ensuring clear and concise communication of the company's offerings.

Senior Frontend Developer, Flint Interactive

2014 - 2016 (2 years)

I was promoted to Senior Frontend Developer at Flint Interactive, and up-skilled in Drupal and Wordpress CMS, which allowed Flint to attract and win more clients and partners. As Lead Developer, I worked with a number of designers and design studios on several big festival and e-commerce websites, including Melbourne Food & Wine Festival, Teach for Australia and RB Sellars. I also had a lot of exposure to other platforms and frameworks, such as Campaign Monitor, MailChimp, Salesforce, Umbraco, Magento and Hubspot.

Frontend Developer, Flint Interactive

2009 - 2014 (5 years)

While beginning my role at Flint Interactive as a flash developer, my flexibility and adaptability led me to become very proficient in PHP, MySQL, HTML, CSS and Javascript. Projects included several high-profile lifestyle brands, such as Stephanie Alexander's Kitchen Garden, Carmens Kitchen, Calibre.

Digital Developer, M&C Saatchi

2008 - 2009 (1 year)

Coming straight from University, my advanced skills as a flash developer allowed me to work on a number of large clients, such as ANZ and Medibank. Highlights include developing an AFL Game for Medibank that was used in their Australia wide marketing campaign during the 2008 AFL season.
content.markdown:
# Work Experience

### Senior Product Engineer, [Alpaca Travel](https://alpaca.travel)
*2016 - present (7 years)*

I have been an integral part of Alpaca Travel since its inception in 2016, contributing significantly to its growth and evolution. I played a pivotal role in crafting the initial prototype that laid the foundation for the company's development. From the initial AngularJS prototype, we transitioned to React and related technologies, a transition I actively participated in. My contributions have spanned a range of key products, including multiple iterations of the CMS, as well as widely adopted content viewers featured on notable brands like Dan Murphy's, Destination NSW, Melbourne Food & Wine, and Australian Travel Magazine.

Highlights of my role:

- Developing Alpaca's fully customised content management system (CMS) tailored for itinerary plotting, boasting advanced features such as customisable branding, AI-driven writing assistance, a robust icon management system, an intuitive embed wizard with preview functionality, and more.
- Developing the fully responsive and embeddable maps, enhancing the interactive experience for users across all devices.
- Developing and successfully delivering a React Native iPhone and Android app to the app store, that empowers users to load maps through QR codes and access them offline, promoting seamless usability.
- Developing / designing downloadable PDFs featuring static maps, custom icons, custom fonts, and branding, delivering a polished and consistent visual identity for brands and their users.
- Developing the [Alpaca Tech](https://alpaca.tech/) landing page and documentation, ensuring clear and concise communication of the company's offerings.

### Senior Frontend Developer, [Flint Interactive](http://www.flintinteractive.com.au/)
*2014 - 2016 (2 years)*

I was promoted to Senior Frontend Developer at Flint Interactive, and up-skilled in Drupal and Wordpress CMS, which allowed Flint to attract and win more clients and partners. As Lead Developer, I worked with a number of designers and design studios on several big festival and e-commerce websites, including Melbourne Food & Wine Festival, Teach for Australia and RB Sellars. I also had a lot of exposure to other platforms and frameworks, such as Campaign Monitor, MailChimp, Salesforce, Umbraco, Magento and Hubspot.


### Frontend Developer, [Flint Interactive](http://www.flintinteractive.com.au/)
*2009 - 2014 (5 years)*

While beginning my role at Flint Interactive as a flash developer, my flexibility and adaptability led me to become very proficient in PHP, MySQL, HTML, CSS and Javascript. Projects included several high-profile lifestyle brands, such as Stephanie Alexander's Kitchen Garden, Carmens Kitchen, Calibre. 


### Digital Developer, [M&C Saatchi](https://www.mcsaatchi.com.au/)
*2008 - 2009 (1 year)*

Coming straight from University, my advanced skills as a flash developer allowed me to work on a number of large clients, such as ANZ and Medibank. Highlights include developing an AFL Game for Medibank that was used in their Australia wide marketing campaign during the 2008 AFL season.

content.html:
Personal Projects

Illustrator, Goldie & Bee

2020 - present (3 years)

As a house portrait illustrator, I offer commissioned services to create personalised and high-quality artwork that captures the beauty of homes. As well as private commissions I also have been engaged for commercial work, including illustrations for 1800 Lasagne and other advertisement materials. With quite a waiting list of commission requests, this keeps me very busy.

Happy Holidays

2022

I wanted an app that allowed me to enter my leave, and give me back optimal dates in order to have the maximum time off, so I built one. This uses open source data to collate all public holidays around the world and no matter what region of the world, it can calculate leave depending on the local public holidays. A very useful tool.

Happy Words

2021

My close friends and I enjoy the New York Times mini crossword - however it was very US centric in its clues/answers, so I decided to build my own DIY mini crossword engine. As a technical goal I wanted to not use a database (to keep ALL costs down to effectively nothing), so this uses the URL as an encrypted state manager (meaning you can share the link, but not derive any of the crosswords answers in the URL).
content.markdown:
# Personal Projects

### Illustrator, [Goldie & Bee](http://www.goldieandbee.com)
*2020 - present (3 years)*

As a house portrait illustrator, I offer commissioned services to create personalised and high-quality artwork that captures the beauty of homes. As well as private commissions I also have been engaged for commercial work, including illustrations for 1800 Lasagne and other advertisement materials. With quite a waiting list of commission requests, this keeps me very busy.

### [Happy Holidays](https://www.happyholidays.app/)
*2022*

I wanted an app that allowed me to enter my leave, and give me back optimal dates in order to have the maximum time off, so I built one. This uses open source data to collate all public holidays around the world and no matter what region of the world, it can calculate leave depending on the local public holidays. A very useful tool.

### [Happy Words](https://tinyurl.com/3f3hcaj4) 
*2021*

My close friends and I enjoy the New York Times mini crossword - however it was very US centric in its clues/answers, so I decided to build my own DIY mini crossword engine. As a technical goal I wanted to not use a database (to keep ALL costs down to effectively nothing), so this uses the URL as an encrypted state manager (meaning you can share the link, but not derive any of the crosswords answers in the URL).

content.html:
heading 1

Overall, our calendar software is the perfect tool for managing your time and staying organized. With its user-friendly interface and powerful search functionality, it's the ideal solution for anyone looking to take control of their schedule and make the most of their time.

heading 2

Additionally, our software integrates seamlessly with popular email services,

so that users can easily invite others and receive updates about events.

heading 3

Try it out today and see the difference for yourself. Overall, our calendar software is a comprehensive and effective tool for managing your time.

Some interesting quote info
content.markdown:
# heading 1

Overall, our calendar software is the *perfect tool* for managing your time and staying organized. With its user-friendly interface and powerful search functionality, it's the ideal solution for anyone looking to take control of their schedule and make the most of their time.

## heading 2

Additionally, our software integrates seamlessly with <mark>popular email services,</mark>

 so that users can easily invite others and receive updates about events.

### heading 3

Try it out today and see the difference for yourself. Overall, our calendar software is a comprehensive and effective tool for managing your time.

> Some interesting quote info
